shapes

Class ShapeBuilder.Arg

  • java.lang.Object
    • shapes.ShapeBuilder.Arg
  • Enclosing class:
    ShapeBuilder

    public static class ShapeBuilder.Arg
extends java.lang.Object
    An immutable class to represent a ShapeBuilder argument. An argument has a String name, and an integer value, with optional bounds restrictions.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Arg(java.lang.String name)
      Creates an argument with the given name and no bounds on the value.
      Arg(java.lang.String name, int minValue)
      Creates an argument with the given name and minimum bound, with no upper bound.
      Arg(java.lang.String name, int minValue, int maxValue)
      Creates an argument with the given name, minimum, and maximum values.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getMaxValue()
      Gets the maximum allowed value of this argument.
      int getMinValue()
      Gets the minimum allowed value of this argument.
      java.lang.String getName()
      Gets the name of this argument.
      boolean test(int value)
      Returns whether or not the given value is within the range as a valid value of this argument.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Arg

        public Arg(java.lang.String name,
           int minValue,
           int maxValue)
        Creates an argument with the given name, minimum, and maximum values.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of this argument.
        minValue - The minimum allowed value of this argument.
        maxValue - The maximum allowed value of this argument.

      • Arg

        public Arg(java.lang.String name,
           int minValue)
        Creates an argument with the given name and minimum bound, with no upper bound. The upper bound is set to Integer.MAX_VALUE, which is effectively unlimited.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of this argument.
        minValue - The minimum allowed value of this argument.

      • Arg

        public Arg(java.lang.String name)
        Creates an argument with the given name and no bounds on the value. The upper and lower bounds are set to Integer min and max values respectively, which is effectively unlimited.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of this argument.

    • Method Detail

      • test

        public boolean test(int value)
        Returns whether or not the given value is within the range as a valid value of this argument.
        Parameters:
        value - The value to test for validity.
        Returns:
        boolean, true if the value is within the range of valid values of this argument, false otherwise.

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Gets the name of this argument.
        Returns:
        String, the name of this argument.

      • getMaxValue

        public int getMaxValue()
        Gets the maximum allowed value of this argument.
        Returns:
